Traitorous Behavior of S. Korean Authorities under Fire
articles.content:
Traitorous Behavior of S. Korean Authorities under Fire 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) reportedly issued a statement titled "The south Korea-U.S. summit talks were sycophantic and traitorous and anti-reunification talks" on Nov. 18.
 Referring to the fact that a "joint declaration" was made public at the summit talks, the statement branded the joint declaration as a sycophantic and traitorous declaration and anti-reunification one as it clearly reflected the U.S. unilateralism and supremacy and hostile policy towards the north.
 The statement blasted Bush who, urging "North Korea's abandonment of its nuclear program," argued that the offer of light water reactors is possible only when the complete abandonment of its nuclear program is recognized.    
 The statement continued:    
 The U.S. is talking about peace on the Korean Peninsula, while raising such condition as a complete abandonment of the nuclear program on one hand and threatening with the "resolution on human rights issue in north Korea" and "economic sanctions" on the other. This is hypocrisy of the U.S.
 The south headquarters bitterly condemns the present "government" for its sycophantic and traitorous act of betraying the future of the nation and people, bound to the humiliating south Korea-U.S. "alliance."

articles.title: S. Korean Religionists Oppose Authorities' Offer of Land to U.S. Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Religionists Oppose Authorities' Offer of Land to U.S. Forces 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The members of four major religious organizations including Kaesin, Buddhism and Round Buddhism in south Korea reportedly met in Seoul on Nov. 22 in protest against the authorities' offer of land for the transfer and expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek.
 Speakers at the meeting accused the "Central Committee for Land Expropriation" of making a decision on approving the forcible acquisition of the land of inhabitants of Phyongthaek who refused to comply with the purchase of land required for the transfer and expansion of the military base there. 
 Underlining the need to check the expansion of the military base without fail for foiling the war scheme of the U.S. and defending the dignity of the nation, they expressed their will to stage a 1,000 day-long movement of praying for averting a war and defending peace from Nov. 27.    
 An appeal was issued in the name of the religious preparatory committee for the "second grand march for peace" due to be held in Phyongthaek on Dec. 11.

articles.title: Academy of Sciences Renamed State Academy of Sciences in DPRK
articles.content:
Academy of Sciences Renamed State Academy of Sciences in DPRK 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Academy of Sciences was renamed the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK.
 According to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly dated Nov. 23, the Academy of Sciences of the DPRK will be renamed the State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK.
 It also says that in this regard the Cabinet of the DPRK and relevant institutions will adopt working measures.

articles.title: Congratulations to Sixth Congress of "United Russia" Party
articles.content:
Congratulations to Sixth Congress of "United Russia" Party 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the All-Russian Party "United Russia" on Nov. 24 on its sixth congress.
 The message hoped that the congress would be an important occasion in the activities of the party to build powerful Russia, defend interests of the Russian people and raise their welfare.    
 In the conviction that the friendly relations between the two parties will contribute to the development of the relations of traditional friendship and cooperation between the two countries and peoples the message wished the party greater successes in the work of its congress and its activities in the future.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Television Trust for the Environment on a visit to the DPRK presented a gift to leader Kim Jong Il.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Kosima Weber Liu who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: International Workshop on Environment Held
articles.content:
International Workshop on Environment Held 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- An international workshop on environment took place here on Nov. 23 and 24.    
 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, director of the Pyongyang International New Technological and Economic Information Centre, experts of the Ministry of Land and Environment Preservation and the State Academy of Sciences, teachers of different universities and officials concerned. 
 Members of a delegation of the Television Trust for the Environment (TVEI) headed by Kosima Weber Liu were also on hand.    
 Speeches were made on measures to improve and strengthen the environmental protection such as ecological environment, technology of using resources, water purification technology, use of renewable energy and protection of birds' habitats.

Russian Performing Art Group Here
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M. E. Pyatnichki led by its Head and Manager Aleksandra Permyakova arrived here Friday.
 It was greeted at the airport by Kwon Hyok Bong, vice- department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and Mikhail Vetrov, councilor of the Russian embassy here.
